description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9msk7","text":"This Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) is based on the Vanderbilt Human Islet Phenotyping Program (HIPP) Islet Functional Analysis. groups.title: Integrated Islet Distribution Program and Human Islet Phenotyping Program

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"9q2gr","text":"Integrated Islet Distribution Program (IIDP) (RRID:SCR_014387): The IIDP is a grant funded program commissioned and funded by the NIDDK to provide quality human islets to the diabetes research community to advance scientific discoveries and translational medicine. The IIDP consists of the NIDDK Project Scientist and Program Official, the External Evaluation Committee and the CC at City of Hope (COH). The IIDP CC integrates an interactive group of academic laboratories including the subcontracted IIDP centers.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":62},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":63}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":15}],"data":{}},{"key":"433s7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"721je","text":"IIDP Coordinating Center (CC): Joyce Niland, Ph.D. and Carmella Evans-Molina, M.D., Ph.D. serve as Co-Principal Investigators (Co-PIs) for the IIDP Program located within the Department of Diabetes and Cancer Discovery Science at COH to coordinate the activities of the IIDP and Human Islet Phenotyping Program (HIPP). Dr. Niland, contact PI, oversees the daily activity of the IIDP staff, provides informatics/ biostatistical input, and subcontracts with the Islet Isolation Centers (IICs) to ensure the delivery of the highest quality human islets to IIDP-approved investigators. Dr. Evans-Molina serves as the liaison to the HIPP, interacting closely to ensure that extensive, high quality phenotypic data are collected on islets distributed by the IICs. She also facilitates the delivery of this information to both the IICs and the IIDP-approved investigators, while responding to questions, issues, or suggestions for further HIPP enhancements.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":29},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fibh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dl05","text":"Human Islet Phenotyping Program (HIPP): The HIPP is a subcontracted entity of the IIDP through the COH and Vanderbilt University. The HIPP is directed by Marcela Brissova, Ph.D. and is responsible for performing specific standardized phenotyping assays agreed upon by both the IIDP and the HIPP, in order to provide enhanced, quality data on the human islets post-shipment, to the IIDP. The results of these assays will be approved by the CC and posted on the IIDP website for both the centers and the approved investigators.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":38},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9i1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dctb0","text":"Actual Islets (AI): The actual number of islets counted.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bodd8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bmct","text":"Islet Equivalent (IEQ): An islet with a diameter of 150 µm determined mathematically   by compensating for islet shape.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":22},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djta","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jck8","text":"Islet Perifusion Assay: A functional assay that acquires dynamic hormone secretory profiles simultaneously from islet cell types such as β and α cells in response to their respective secretagogues. Insulin and glucagon are detected in perifusion fractions by hormone assay. The islet hormone secretory profile is generated by graphing hormone concentration over time with respect to islet volume and/or hormone content.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":22},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv2pq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8110m","text":"Secretagogue: {"blocks":[{"key":"7o6k6","text":"Place the bottles of media in the water bath to warm up for at least 10 minutes before beginning the perifusion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1disk","text":"Replace Pyrex orange caps with 4-Luer (+1) caps on every bottle of media to be used, and tape over the holes so that gas cannot escape.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hdbq","text":"Turn on gas (95% O², 5% CO²), and place one gas catheter into each of the bottles with the new caps.  Put tape over the other holes on the caps. {"blocks":[{"key":"80r8b","text":"Place intake catheters into baseline media bottle, making sure that they reach to the bottom of the bottle. {"blocks":[{"key":"7svo9","text":"On the day of islet receipt, plate a half of islet shipment (1000 - 5000 IEQs) in 10-cm non-tissue culture treated Petri dish and culture in CMRL-1066 plus 10% FBS media at 37°C/5% CO² for 2 hours prior to perifusion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":27},{"style":"italic","offset":189,"length":27},{"style":"sub","offset":183,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9h7q5","text":"Place petri dish with cultured islets on the stage of inverted microscope and view the islets under 4x objective.  Use the micrometer in the 10x eyepiece to size the islets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"el6fj","text":"Under microscope guidance handpick 267–300 IEQs using the chart below and record islet size and count in the Islet Cell Calculation Excel Worksheet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":108,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h0e6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ihcu","text":"  ","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7gfd3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"97D6A700A1E211EBB6E3D31D62D9572B","height":125,"id":138284,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"ICC.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ehbqbghg7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ehbnbghg7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ehbpbghg7.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ehbmbghg7.webp","width":336}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7mapt","text":"Place the dish containing islets on the stage of a stereomicroscope equipped with a high-resolution camera and swirl until all islets are in the camera field of view at 10x magnification. Capture brightfield images at approximately 12-ms exposure and darkfield images at approximately 1.2-s exposure, each at 10x magnification. Ensure all islets are present in image. Save all image files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsrnr","text":"Transfer all islets from the center of the dish to a labeled    clear Eppendorf tube for loading into perifusion chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e0jfb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"E9C82560A69811EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bvefm","text":"Open the darkfield image in the cellSens software. Using the manual HSV threshold function, segment the islet tissue channel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3ien","text":"Use the custom Count and Measure algorithm to determine islet count and mean islet diameter.  Split adjacent but discrete islets using the Manually Split Objects tool to get an accurate islet count and mean diameter measurements.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rm3n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93sdq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdbcl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e6mff","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":60,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"1eufv","text":"Note:  Perifusion IEQ analysis by cellSens began 06/19/2018.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lg8a","text":"Use the mean diameter measurements to assign islets to a diameter group using the chart provided in 4.4 above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lbel","text":"Islet Loading into the Perifusion Chamber","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c9ig8","text":"Turn off the pump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"asmfo","text":"Turn the stopcock on the air bubble uptake lines so that the waste pathway is open, and close the stopcock on the outlet line at the fraction collector.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51inr","text":"Remove the chamber from its mounting, turn it upside down, and remove the red end piece (inlet).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"tad2","text":"Remove and discard two thirds of the media from the chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fj2u","text":"Using a   pipette set to    transfer the slurry of islets from the Eppendorf tube to the perifusion chamber.  Rinse the tube at least 3 times with    of baseline medium, and transfer to the chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":25,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":147,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b6td3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"7B63C590A69B11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"700","error":false,"guid":"8D322EB0A69B11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"700","error":false,"guid":"9E23CC60A69B11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7oci","text":"Place the chamber back onto the mounting, and fill it up with baseline medium until there is a convex meniscus.  Tap the sides of the column lightly to dislodge air bubbles from the walls, and collect and discard any bubbles from the top of the meniscus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eant3","text":"When all the bubbles have been removed, carefully replace the inlet plunger. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hgf0","text":"NOTE- make sure that no bubbles are introduced into the chamber during this process; if bubbles get in, remove the plunger, and repeat step 5.6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8f0cd","text":"Turn the chamber right side up, and put it back on the mounting rack.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eh8uu","text":"Open the outlet line at the fraction collector and close the waste line on the air bubble uptake line.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cnop","text":"Turn on the pump, set the fraction collector to 3 minutes and flip the collector arm so that it is over the first collection tube. Press “Start” on the collector to start the timer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2o2g0","text":"Tighten column end pieces, and end fittings, and make sure there are no leaks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jntm","text":"Lower the column mounting rack into the water bath, and tighten the clamp to prevent wobbling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1et6v","text":"Fraction Collector Startup and Islet Wash Period","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1h35m","text":"Collect 10 preliminary fractions to synchronize pump speed to deliver   3-minute fractions, and to rinse the islets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":70,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9atbi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"39C71730A69C11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9g9n","text":"Record each pump speed on the perifusion worksheet in the perifusion logbook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9ep1","text":"Collection of Perifusate Fractions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eetl5","text":"Begin to collect fractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1p8m3","text":"Change secretagogues at predetermined fractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"79ee1","text":"As soon as the fraction collector moves, switch off the pump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5r3ak","text":"Move the needles from one secretagogue to the other, making sure to not tangle the tubing, and inserting the needle all the way to the bottom of the bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a67to","text":"When the needles have been moved, restart the pump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1pmre","text":"Recovery of Islets from Chamber and Perifusion System Cleanup","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":61}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dal7e","text":"At the end of the perifusion raise the mounting rack from the water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14e1b","text":"Stop pumps and close all outlets. Wait about 2 minutes, so that the islets can drift down to the bottom of the chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5to86","text":"Carefully remove the blue end piece (outlet) from the first chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9m7uk","text":"Pour the medium from the chamber into a 60 mm untreated dish, and rinse out the chamber and the blue column end piece with   of baseline medium 5 times each into the dish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":123,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dpqbk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"8D98EA50A69C11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ml06","text":"Rinse the chamber with deionized water, and remove frit with a frit removal stage and tool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9u692","text":"Put the column back together, and run 10% bleach through them at maximum pump speed for about 15 minutes. Make sure that all the tubing gets bleached, including all the waste lines. After the bleach, run deionized water through the entire system at maximum speed for 1.5 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9uttf","text":"After the system cleanup, turn off the pump using the master power switch, turn off and drain the water bath, and log the perifusion in the notebook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"122lg","text":"Perform any scheduled maintenance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"87f6q","text":"Islet Hormone Extraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8cnt0","text":"After retrieving islets from the perifusion chamber, size and count retrieved islets (step 4.4) to determine IEQ and record islet size and count in Islet Cell Calculation Excel Worksheet. Transfer the islets to a    Eppendorf tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":117,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":139,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":213,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a0gdq","text":"Note: The average expected retrieval rate is approximately 93%. Lower islet recovery has been observed for islets showing hallmarks of disintegration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hrhl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"FE08CA30A69C11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fhkgg","text":"Centrifuge the tubes for 3 minutes at 200 rcf and aspirate the supernatant using a pipette, being careful not to disturb the islet pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk4v5","text":"Remove as much supernatant as possible from the tube, using a   tip, followed by a    tip and place tube on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":62,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a4ksc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"DD1FF460A69C11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"EE228200A69C11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qgfr","text":"Prepare fresh acid alcohol for hormone extraction by adding   of concentrated HCl to    of 95% ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"atoco","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"33C77CC0A69D11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5.5","error":false,"guid":"40CD3A40A69D11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22t4l","text":"Add   of acid alcohol to tube containing islets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1qlfd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"569F9F70A69D11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5h3e8","text":"Incubate sample at   for 24 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"93a9p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"680A3DB0A69D11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"441cq","text":"Spin samples down for 5 minutes at 3000 rcf, and transfer three    supernatant aliquots into pre-labeled    screwcap tubes and store at     .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":105,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":137,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5b22h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"77C33450A69D11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"865DC2A0A69D11EBADFF2581110BE8D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"6A600F80A2B611EB86DB37B4A732848D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"53m97","text":"Data Storage and Reporting","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"949c7","text":"To facilitate data management and ensure data security, the Vanderbilt HIPP uses an institutional server-based platform for data storage and analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"56srk","text":"Deviations and Resolutions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
